results.title: A City is
results.creator_credit: James Carney, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More than buildings, more than people, a city is a total expression of purpose and aspiration, past and present. This is a multi-image look at the conglomerate city, composed of a whole stream of visual and auditory impressions presented without commentary. Often the screen subdivides - two, three, a dozen images appear at the same time, creating a counterpoint of the turbulence and discord, the harmony and sophistication of the big city.

results.title: A Calendar of dreamings: Aboriginal artists of Central Australia
results.brief_description: This film depicts mythological aspects of Aboriginal life in the western McDonald Range area of Central Australia with specific reference to three tribal groups. It deals with ‘water dreaming’ as well as various myths and legends related to the present situation of the Aboriginals. The film incorporates approximately 44 paintings by Central Aborigines using an ancient technique known as sand painting. A study of the meanings of the symbols and signs used in Australian aboriginal paintings. Legends of the Aboriginal’s Dreamtime are passed down to the younger member by their elders in ritual ceremonies. Narrated by John Bell, edited by Phil Noyce.

results.title: A Christmas Special with Luciano Pavarotti
results.brief_description: A glorious concert performed at the spectacular Notre Dame Cathedral, Montreal, Luciano Pavarotti’s Christmas present to music lovers everywhere. Conducted by Franz Paul Decker with “Les Petits Chanteurs” and “Les disciples de Massenmet”. Features “Christmas Medley”, “O Holy Night”, “Pieta Signore”, “Gloria”, “Silent Night”, “Ave Maria”, “Mille Cherubini in Coro”, “Agnus Dei”, “Gesu Bambino”, “Panis Angelicus”, “Oh Come All Ye Faithful”, “O Jesu Christii”, and “Hallelujah Chorus”.

results.title: A Busy sort of bloke: Harold Hughan
results.creator_credit: Crafts Council of Australia, Lindsay Frazer, Gillian Armstrong and Australia Council
results.brief_description: The simplicity and charm of the man and his work are portrayed in this film, which shows Harold Hughan at home and at work. He is seen making a platter, and he discusses the objective of his pieces made with clay. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Christmas gift
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Billy Budd Films and Film Loft Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated film by Will Vinto capturing the spirit of Christmas, where the happiest Christmas is shared by a young boy and an old lady over a simple candle-lit dinner of cheese, bread and wine. Based on the song entitled ‘Christmas Dinner’ by Paul Stookey of Peter, Paul and Mary.

results.title: A Christmas fantasy
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film depicts impressions of the lights of Christmas as they transform a winter’s night. Captures the illusive magic of a northern Christmas when fresh snow lies softly on pine trees and roof tops and multi-coloured lights glow on surfaces of purest white. The myriad lights of a city, the wonder on children’s faces, lyrical music, dramatic colour effects with trick photography - all combine to create the nostalgic mood of Christmas. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: A Burlesque on Carmen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Jesse Robbins and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: This film was intended by Chaplin to be a two-reel film, but to his annoyance additional material was added after he left Essanay, the Production Company of the film. It is a parody of two contemporary films based on Bizet’s opera, by Cecil B. De Mille (starring Geraldine Ferrar) and Raoul Walsh (starring vamp Theda Bara). Chaplin plays Darn Hosiery (Don Jose), the Corporal of the Guard who is seduced by Carmen (Edna Purviance) so that gypsy smugglers can get their swag through the city gates. His chief rivals for Carmen’s affections are Escamillo, the toreador and a fellow soldier of the guard, Leo White.

results.title: A Choice of two
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: White-collar crime and corporate in-fighting merge as a chairman of the board must choose his successor from between two competent executives. All eyes are on the contenders when it is discovered that a defrauding of Farabee Industries is being orchestrated by someone within the arena of power. This drama was based on an actual case history and looks at an aspect of business ethics. Stars Leslie Nielsen. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: A Bronx tale
results.creator_credit: Robert De Niro, John Kilik, Jane Rosenthal and Tribeca Productions
results.brief_description: Calogero Anello is a streetwise nine year old whose father Lorenzo, fights to keep him from being corrupted by the neighbourhood in which they live. The boy witnesses a murder but refuses to identify Sonny, the local crime boss he has long admired, as the perpetrator. Sonny becomes a “surrogate” father to the boy, teaching him to survive in the streets. Over the next eight years, Lorenzo is powerless to stop his son from adopting the dangerous lifestyle of his hero Sonny. Robert De Niro stars and directs this often poignant but tragic motion picture.

results.title: A Chinese ghost story II = Sinnui yauman II [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Golden Princess Film Production Ltd
results.brief_description: The story has its origins in a Chinese short story by Pu Song-ling which was also the basis of Li Hanxiang’s 1958 film, ‘The Enchanted Shadow’. The internationally successful trio of ‘Chinese Ghost Story’ films integrates ideas and images from Western movies and John Carpenter films with the classical Chinese story. Here, the plot takes up where part 1 leaves off, with Leslie Cheung as a wandering scholar turning his back on the gates of hell, only to find himself fending off attacks from a decomposing giant. He is drawn into guerilla action to free an unjustly imprisoned official and finds himself torn between the love of the official’s two daughters. The film is a mixture of high style, low comedy, steamy romantic interludes, spectacular special effects and rapid-fire editing. Cast also includes Wang Zu Zian (Wang Tsu-hsien) and Wu Ma (Wo Ma). In Cantonese with English subtitles.
